intro: When people think of okra (also known as "ladies' fingers"), they often think of a slimy, difficult-to-eat vegetable and so tend to avoid it. While okra

steps.title: Choose okra that is evenly green and about 2 to 4 inches (5-10 cm) long.
steps.subtitle: Too large and the okra will have a flat taste, and may be too tough to eat. Too small, and the okra will be difficult to cook.
sub-points: Avoid okra that look shriveled or are soft when squeezed.
The okra should snap rather than bend.
